result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaitlyn S. Todnem

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:15 p.m.  Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan -  10 months in Pierce County Jail, concurrent on each count, also concurrent with Eau Claire County case, no prison time.  Rivard - concurrs with State that prison is not appropriate, asks for bottom of probation's recommendation, 8 months concurrent on each count and also concurrent with Eau Claire County case.  Has 176 days credit at this time. In custody since April 4, 2016.  Ms. Todnem addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Court orders 9 months in Pierce County Jail, on each count but concurrent with each other, also concurrent with charges in Eau Claire County.  Costs to be reduced to civil judgment in the amount of $1,036.00.  $326.00 unpaid costs,  plus $26.00 Other Costs,  plus $184.00 Victim Witness Fees, plus $500.00 DNA surcharge.  Release date of October 22, 2016.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.
from Probation/Parole Agent Dawn Christopher re: requesting eight to ten months on Ct #1 and Ct#2 ; concurrent to each other and 14CF1063 (Eau Claire County case)
filed by Probation/Parole Agent Dawn Christopher
F Rivard
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

1:45 Includes 15TR556, 15TR557  Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OSullivan - Plead to the 2 ct in the amended information.  Probation 3 years and expungment if successfully completes probation   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15cf102      DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 2 in 15CF102    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2.  15TR556  will be dismissed. Court orders S/W 3 years probation on each count concurrent.  Cond:  Court Costs DNA Sample and Surcharge. Comply with all conditions set by the agent.
Plea hearing at 03-15-2016 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference at 01-12-2016 10:00 am.
Motion hearing at 11-03-2015 11:30 am

2:58 Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in court via phone with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15TR556 and 15TR557 heard at this time. OSullivan set for a motion hearing. Nelson agrees.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:30 am.
to Suppress Evidence filed by Atty Nelson
Status conference at 09-21-2015 02:55 pm.

11:21 Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15TR556 and 15TR557 heard at this time. OSullivan requests a bench warrant body only. Nelson objections to warrant and requests a motion hearing be set. Court calls Defendant. No answers. Court set for telephone status conference to get Defendant here and will take up warrant then.
Motion hearing at 09-08-2015 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 07-14-2015 11:45 am

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Defendant has a copy of the information  and court reads the information .  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Ct 1, Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5 and Ct 6 at preliminary hearing.    Not guilty plea received by the court on all six counts.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Pretrial Conference to be set.

4:09 p.m.  Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan - Ms. Todnem does not have counsel.  Liesel Nelson indicates Ms. Todnem qualified for public defender.  Off the record at 4:11 p.m.  Court resumes at 4:30 p.m.  Liesl Nelson in court with Kaitlyn S. Todnem.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing at 06-22-2015 04:00 pm

3:40 Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Kaitlyn S. Todnem in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and maximum penalty's.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: $200 cash bond. Bub: requests signature bond. Court: $3000 signature bond. Def has never been in the armed services.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
